title: Intel Open Source License (Intel)
description: A short license, deprecated by Intel and based on the BSD license, that provides minimal protection for the author.

must.title: Include License
must.description: Including the full text of license in modified software.

cannot.title: Hold Liable
cannot.description: Describes the warranty and if the software/license owner can be charged for damages.

can.title: Modify
can.description: Describes the ability to modify the software and create derivatives.

can.title: Distribute
can.description: Describes the ability to distribute original or modified (derivative) works.

can.title: Commercial Use
can.description: Describes the ability to use the software for commercial purposes.

can.title: Sublicense
can.description: Describes the ability for you to grant/extend a license to the software.

fulltext:

EXPORT LAWS: THIS LICENSE ADDS NO RESTRICTIONS TO THE EXPORT LAWS OF YOUR JURISDICTION. It is licensee's responsibility to comply with any export regulations applicable in licensee's jurisdiction. Under CURRENT (May 2000) U.S. export regulations this software is eligible for export from the U.S. and can be downloaded by or otherwise exported or reexported worldwide EXCEPT to U.S. embargoed destinations which include Cuba, Iraq, Libya, North Korea, Iran, Syria, Sudan, Afghanistan and any other country to which the U.S. has embargoed goods and services.
